tool.name: GDAL warp
tool.command:
gdalwarp
#for $i, $s in enumerate( $series ) '${s.input}' #end for
#unless $of=='' -of '$of' #end unless
#if $condi_tr.tr=='tr' -tr $condi_tr.xres $condi_tr.yres #end if
#unless $s_srs=='' -s_srs '$s_srs' #end unless
#unless $t_srs=='' -t_srs '$t_srs' #end unless
#if $settings.advanced=="advanced"
#unless $settings.to=='NAME=VALUE' -to $settings.to #end unless
#unless $settings.wo=='NAME=VALUE' -wo $settings.wo #end unless
#unless $settings.order=='no_value' -order $settings.order #end unless
#if $settings.condi_resample.resample=='resampling' -r $settings.condi_resample.r #end if
#if $settings.condi_et.et=='et' -et $settings.condi_et.et #end if
#if $settings.condi_refine_gcps.refine_gcps=='refine_gcps' -refine_gcps $settings.condi_refine_gcps.tolerance $settings.condi_refine_gcps.minimum_gcps #end if
#if $settings.condi_te.te=='te' -te $settings.condi_te.xmin $settings.condi_te.ymin $settings.condi_te.xmax $settings.condi_te.ymax #end if
$settings.tps $settings.rpc $settings.geoloc
#unless $settings.srcnodata=='' -srcnodata '$settings.srcnodata' #end unless
$settings.dstalpha #end if
'$output'

param.name: of
param.label: Output format
param.help: Select the output format. The default is GeoTIFF (GTiff). Use the short format name. http://www.gdal.org/formats_list.html

param.name: s_srs
param.label: Source spatial reference set
param.help: The coordinate systems that can be passed are anything supported by the OGRSpatialReference.SetFromUserInput() call, which includes EPSG PCS and GCSes (i.e. EPSG:4296), PROJ.4 declarations (as above), or the name of a .prj file containing well known text.

param.name: tr
param.label: -tr
param.help: Set output file resolution (in target georeferenced units

param.name: to
param.label: -to Transformer option
param.help: Set a transformer option suitable to pass to GDALCreateGenImgProjTransformer2().

param.name: wo
param.label: -wo Warp Option
param.help: Set a warp option. The GDALWarpOptions::papszWarpOptions docs show all options. Multiple -wo options may be listed.

param.name: order
param.label: -order n
param.help: Order of polynomial used for warping (1 to 3). The default is to select a polynomial order based on the number of GCPs.

param.name: tps
param.label: -tps
param.help: Force use of thin plate spline transformer based on available GCPs.

param.name: srcnodata
param.label: -srcnodata value
param.help: Set nodata masking values for input bands (different values can be supplied for each band). If more than one value is supplied all values should be quoted to keep them together as a single operating system argument. Masked values will not be used in interpolation. Use a value of None to ignore intrinsic nodata settings on the source dataset.

param.name: dstalpha
param.label: -dstalpha
param.help: Create an output alpha band to identify nodata (unset/transparent) pixels.

param.name: et
param.label: -et error threshold
param.help: Error threshold for transformation approximation (in pixel units - defaults to 0.125, unless the RPC_DEM warping option is specified, in which case, an exact transformer, i.e. err_threshold=0, will be used).

param.name: refine_gcps
param.label: Use the option -refine_gcps
param.help: Refines the GCPs by automatically eliminating outliers. Outliers will be eliminated until minimum_gcps are left or when no outliers can be detected. The tolerance is passed to adjust when a GCP will be eliminated. Not that GCP refinement only works with polynomial interpolation. The tolerance is in pixel units if no projection is available, otherwise it is in SRS units. If minimum_gcps is not provided, the minimum GCPs according to the polynomial model is used.

param.name: te
param.label: -te
param.help: Set georeferenced extents of output file to be created (in target SRS by default).

tool.help:
The gdalwarp utility is an image mosaicing, reprojection and warping utility. The program can reproject to any supported projection, and can also apply GCPs stored with the image if the image is "raw" with control information.
http://www.gdal.org
http://www.gdal.org/gdalwarp.html
Raster Processing Tutorial : https://trac.osgeo.org/gdal/wiki/UserDocs/RasterProcTutorial
